column14: How difficult did you find the musical task?
column15: To what extent do you feel you learned something from this activity?
column16: Do you think using the system multiple times would improve your skills (e.g., ear training, musicality)?
column17: Any further feedback you'd like to add?
Would be nice to have a toggle to see notes
It was confusing to me as a guitarist to see the fretboard arranged from top to bottom instead of left to right.

Future work could be to extend the range of the fretboard. Also, this would let more notes be able to be played on multiple strings; perfect pitch people could be less domineering because of the options, haha

The interface could include clues about the difference in strings (width diffs, perspective, overlay on guitar pic etc). When playing with a real-time guitar it is easier to orient yourself on the neck. While searching for sounds in the UI interface I was constantly getting confused were to find higher/lower notes.
I felt during the test that i was not able to pick out tones as what was played came from a speaker of a differrent quality,
I absolutely loved the interactive version, i can imagine using this version when im on the go if i were to be training musical notes/pitch. It's great!
